alert.note: Alert for Mariposa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 9:26AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Pohono Bridge affecting Mariposa County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Merced River...including Pohono Bridge...flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Pohono Bridge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Northside Drive and Southside Drive, which are the main roads in Yosemite Valley, become flooded and are closed to traffic. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM PDT Saturday was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.4 feet late tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 05/16/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1000 AM PDT.
